definition: to visit (a meeting, class, trial etc)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: Can I sit in on your Intermediate Hittite class?
sentences.chinese: 我能旁聽你的“中級希泰語”課程嗎？

sentences.english: Several women who have suffered the unusual fractures testified at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 有幾位曾患不明原因骨折的女士旁聽了這次會議。

sentences.english: The hearing started, he raised his left hand to pay tribute to the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 聽證會開始前，他舉起左手，向旁聽席致意。

sentences.english: Hasan Nuhanovic was one of the survivors watching from the public gallery.
sentences.chinese: 努哈諾維奇是在旁聽席觀看的生還者之一。

sentences.english: You can find charts outlining the class winners, as well as the runners-up, in the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 你可以找到圖表概述級冠軍，以及亞軍，在旁聽席上。

sentences.english: Once in court, he gave a thumbs-up to associates in the public gallery.
sentences.chinese: 他一出現在法庭，就向旁聽席的夥伴豎起大拇指。

sentences.english: Jeffrey was allowed to listen in on the committee's debate.
sentences.chinese: 傑夫裏被允許旁聽委員會的討論。

sentences.english: Some relatives of the victims wept in the courtroom as Ridgway confessed.
sentences.chinese: 一些受害人家屬在旁聽瑞奇維的陳述時泣不成聲。

sentences.english: Some districts allow homeschoolers to attend school part-time and participate in music or sports programs.
sentences.chinese: 一些學區允許孩子參加學校旁聽或音樂和體育課程。

sentences.english: Hillary and I were in court with Mother when he was sentenced.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑被判刑的時候，我和希拉里陪着母親出庭旁聽。

sentences.english: The visitor's gallery in the House of Commons was full.
sentences.chinese: 下議院的旁聽席上坐滿了人。

sentences.english: A hearing is scheduled for Dec. 5 in Linn County juvenile court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭旁聽將在12月5號的林恩郡青年法庭舉行。

sentences.english: OK, do you want to register for this course officially or you just want to be an auditor?
sentences.chinese: 好的，你是像正式地註冊這門課還是隻是想做旁聽生？

sentences.english: Did you audit Professor Lin's class yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 你昨天有去旁聽林教授的課嗎？

sentences.english: Note: Elderly learners will enroll only in "audit" mode.
sentences.chinese: 長者學員將以旁聽生身份申請報讀單元。

sentences.english: The strict limit auditor, cold has been ambitious innumerably people's heart which studies.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格限制旁聽生，冷了無數有志求學的人們的心。

definition: to be present/to be on the scene
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
student studying abroad/(foreign) exchange student/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
